comments.body:
from https://medium.com/@daveshawley/safely-using-setup-cfg-for-metadata-1babbe54c108 

> If you want to use configuration in setup.cfg, then you should make life a little better on your users and include the pkg_resources.require call in your setup.py. It means fewer confused users creating issues for you and makes even educate your users about one of the dirtier corners of python packaging.
Or maybe set a min setuptools version in pyproject.toml?

I would maybe put jinja, tabulate and xarray in a different table, as those are not used in compute anything in pandas (or make plots), but for conversion to / represenation as another format (formatted string, styled html, or xarray object)

Yeah... I was basically trying to create a miscellaneous section without directly calling it misc. :sweat_smile: 

I'll just buckle down and label it Miscellaneous unless you have a different suggestion? I just didn't want to split it into two/three items per table.
